sentences.english: On the sixth day, they gathered twice as much-two omers for each person-and the leaders of the community came and reported this to Moses.
sentences.chinese: 到第六天，他们收了双倍的食物，每人两俄梅珥。

sentences.english: However, the Japanese people do not have a double dose of original sin.
sentences.chinese: 但是，日本民众并没有双倍的原罪。

sentences.english: The cost of yogurt was suddenly double.
sentences.chinese: 酸奶酪的消费突然变成了双倍了。

sentences.english: A capital-gains tax and a valued-added tax had been brought in, and the double taxation of dividends ended.
sentences.chinese: 政府推行资本税和增值税，终结分红的双倍税。

sentences.english: Correction of the double deductions of Goths during a trade.
sentences.chinese: 修正了在交易戈司时的双倍扣除额。

sentences.english: There's a double bend of the body.
sentences.chinese: 有一个身体的双倍的弯曲处。

sentences.english: Often, this translates to payments of overtime and double overtime.
sentences.chinese: 这通常意味着加班工资和双倍的加班时间。

sentences.english: Actually, you can make that memories, plural.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，你可以将目标记忆变为双倍的。

sentences.english: The AHG itself was also titrated in isotonic saline by a master doubling-dilution technique.
sentences.chinese: AHG本身也采用等渗盐水双倍稀释滴定测量技术。

sentences.english: Double long dryers Web speed of up to 18 metres per second.
sentences.chinese: 双倍长的干燥装置的卷筒纸速度可达到每秒18米。

sentences.english: That's partly why the expenses for others doubled.
sentences.chinese: 这是其他支出双倍增长的部分原因。

sentences.english: The dual stimulation of right and left hands will provide much pleasure for the receiver.
sentences.chinese: 左右手的双倍刺激将给予她多而多之的快感。

sentences.english: Under the new law, the manager will pay double that.
sentences.chinese: 在新的法规中，这个经理人需要支付双倍的税。

sentences.english: He paid double for the customized car. (adv.
sentences.chinese: 他付双倍的价钱购买订制的车辆。

sentences.english: The twice nourishes the composition, jet black and bright hair of ream.
sentences.chinese: 双倍滋养成份，令头发乌黑亮泽。

sentences.english: It's got two shots of caffeinated espresso.
sentences.chinese: 它带了双倍浓度的咖啡因。

definition: to break even/to guarantee a minimum (salary etc)
to bring up to full strength/to make up a deficiency/to fill (a vacancy, gap etc)
to count and check/to tally/points (collected in some bonus scheme etc)
restitution/return of something to its original owner/remittance
